IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: The Edward and Rose Berman Legacy Foundation's primary purpose is to achieve charitable goals by acting as a supporting organization for the benefit of the Jewish Federation of Greater Pittsburgh.

IRS990.Desc: Distributions to supported organization - Jewish Federation of Greater Pittsburgh 2000 Technology Drive PGH PA 15219

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: The Edward and Rose Berman Legacy Foundation provided grants to beneficiary agencies of the Jewish Federation of Greater Pittsburgh and other Jewish and local organizations approved by the Jewish Federation of Greater Pittsburgh. All grants support the overall mission of the Jewish Federation of Greater Pittsburgh to improve the quality of Jewish life.

OtherAssetsOrgGrp.Desc: Cash Surrender Value of Life Insurance

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Part X Line 2 - Footnote taken from audited combined financial statements of the Jewish Federation of Greater Pittsburgh. The Edward and Rose Berman Legacy Foundation is part of these combined statements. The JFGP is a tax-exempt organization under Section 501c 3 of the Internal Revenue Code IRC and is also classified as an entity that is not a private foundation. The PJEIF and Pre-K and four supporting foundations are tax-exempt supporting organizations of the JFGP under Section 501c3 of the IRC. The Federation follows the Codification topic on Income Taxes. The topic prescribes a minimum recognition threshold and measurement methodology that a tax position taken or expected to be taken in a tax return is required to meet before beingrecognized in financial statements. The Federation classifies interest and penalties as tax expense if incurred. The Federation's combined statements of financial position at June 30 2020 and 2019 do not include any liabilities associated with uncertain tax positions; further the Federation has no unrecognized tax benefits. The Federation believes that it is no longer subject to examination of its tax returns for years before 2016.

Part I Line 2 Grants are distributed primarily to the defined supporting organization Jewish Federation of Greater Pittsburgh and other organizations as approved by the Board of Directors. All grants and beneficiaries are approved by the Board of Directors prior to being awarded the funds. The Organization maintains close relationships with the grantees to ensure the funds are being appropriately spent.

The Form 990 is reviewed in detail by the chief Financial Officer and Controller of the Jewish Federation of Greater Pittsburgh and the Treasurer of the Edward and Rose Berman Legacy Foundation before filing with the Internal Revenue Service.

The Form 990 is reviewed in detail by the Chief Financial Officer and Controller of the Jewish Federation of Greater Pittsburgh and the Treasurer of the Edward and Rose Berman Legacy Foundation before filing with the Internal Revenue Service. Additionally the Audit Committee of the Jewish Federation of Greater Pittsburgh reviews the Form 990. The Audit Committee of the Jewish Federation of Greater Pittsburgh has been charged with the review and approval of the Form 990 by the Board of Directors of the Jewish Federation of Greater Pittsburgh.
The Organization's governing documents and financial statements are on file at the offices of the Jewish Federation of Greater Pittsburgh and are available upon request.

| Explanation:| The Edward and Rose Berman Legacy Foundation is a supporting organization of the Jewish Federation of Greater Pittsburgh and is consolidated with the Jewish Federation of Greater Pittsburgh's audited financial statements. The Jewish Federation of Greater Pittsburgh maintains a written conflict of interest policy whistle blower policy and document retention and destruction policy. While the Edward and Rose Berman Legacy Foundation does not have unique versions of these policies it is covered under the Jewish Federation of Greater Pittsburgh as a part of the consolidated organization.
